ranked_diseases.explanation: Rhabdoid Tumor Predisposition Syndrome 1 is associated with SMARCB1 mutations and a high risk of developing atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors, particularly in young children.
Rhabdoid Tumor Predisposition Syndrome 2, related to SMARCA4 mutations, presents similarly with atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors in early childhood.
Although primarily characterized by schwannomas, Schwannomatosis can also involve mutations in SMARCB1, which is linked to rhabdoid tumors as part of the spectrum of manifestations.
